title: In what century did the history of the steam engine begin? - Quora

response.answer_text: All of the other answers are wrong. The Steam Engine was invented by a guy named “Hero,” back in ~50 BC:  (Wikipedia) Typically, and as Hero described the device, the water is heated in a simple boiler which forms part of a stand for the rotating vessel. Where this is the case, the boiler is connected to the rotating chamber by a pair of pipes that also serve as the pivots for the chamber. Alternatively the rotating chamber may itself serve as the boiler, and this arrangement greatly simplifies the pivot/bearing arrangements, as they then do not need to pass steam. This can be seen in the illustration of a classroom model shown here. (Wikipedia)Hero developed his steam engine to demonstrate steam power, and win bar bets, but mostly mostly to win bar bets…

In what century did the history of the steam engine begin? The very end of the 17th Century - as in 1698! Thomas Savery - Wikipedia Savery’s Fire Engine was very inefficient - but a lot cheaper than a horse driven pump so it came into quite general use and paved the way for more efficient steam engines in the early 1700’s (18th Century)
